The Gov. will be on CNNs NewsNight tonight at 10:00pm EDT.
The interview was taped earlier in the day with Wolf Blitzer, who guest hosting for Aaron Brown.
Joe Trippi, Campaign Manager of Dean For America to appear on CNN's Inside Politics today at 3:30 pm EST.
ABC World News tonight will air a segment on Govenor Dean.

event.summary: Conference Call with Young Supporters and Youth Media
event.details:
Governor Howard Dean will announce the details of his higher education policy plan on Thursday, November 13, 2003 at 11:00 AM in a national conference call with members of Generation Dean, members of the education community, representatives of youth media outlets, and everyone concerned about the state of higher education today.
The plan includes proposals for assuring every American the opportunity to attend college and making higher education more affordable. Governor Dean is announcing the plan via a conference call because he wants everyone who has been affected by these issues to find out first-hand how he intends to help.
PLEASE CLICK ON THE LINK BELOW to sign up for this call.
Governor Dean campaigns in New Hampshire. For more information, please contact the NH Press Office at 603-222-1900.
Trippi will be on NPRs Diane Rehm Show TOMORROW between 10:00am and 10:15am. You should be able to listen live by SCROLLING DOWN and CLICKING on the LINK below.

Tonight at 8 p.m. EST (5 p.m. PST) Latinos For Dean will sponsor a National Policy Conference Call with Maria Echaveste, Senior Advisor to Governor Dean on Latino affairs. This will mark a unique opportunity for the Latino community to hear Governor Dean's positions on Latino issues.
To participate in the National Policy Conference Call dial the toll free number(888) 422-7120 and then dial the call I.D. number which is 557963.
Ms. Echaveste will answer questions selected from those previously posted on the Latinos For Dean website. This event is open to the press.
Any further questions please contact german@latinosfordean.com or diego@latinosfordean.com) at Latinos For Dean.
Please CLICK on the LINK below to checkout Latinos for Dean

Governor Dean campaigns in Iowa joining supporters and Melissa Ethridge for a rally in Des Moines at Central Campus High School.
For more information, please contact the IA Press Office at 515-243-5433.

Join Americans nationwide in celebrating Governor Dean's 55th Birthday on November 15th. On Saturday evening, November 15th, at 6:20 pm ET, Governor Dean will join us for an exclusive telephone conference call. As a special treat, the Governor's mother, Andree Dean, will introduce her son for this special family occasion. Dean for America campaign policy requires that all events take place at homes.
Over 5,700 Americans joined in on the conference call via 330 Birtday Bash houseparties nationwide. If you want to share your house party experiences or have questions about houseparties, please post your coments on our Forums.
Click on the link below to get into our forums.

Governor Dean will attend Iowa Jefferson Jackson Dinner which will be broadcasted live on CSPAN starting at 6:00 pm. Check our blogs for live report throughout the day.
To view photos from JJ Dinner please click on the link below.

On November 18, Latinos For Dean will be sponsoring a 2nd National Policy Conference Call with Maria Echaveste, Senior Advisor to Governor Dean, to discuss issues of importance to the Latino community. All Latinos, Latino leaders and activists, policy analysts, and grassroots volunteers are welcome to participate regardless of political affiliation.
If you have any questions regarding this event please visit our 'About Us' page at Latinos For Dean, where you will find state and national contacts that can help you by CLICKING on the LINK BELOW.
The call will occur at 8 pm EST, 5 pm PST. The phone number and access code will be provided on the Latinos for Dean website on the evening of November 18th.

Want to help Howard Dean win your state? Join Joe Trippi, local and national campaign staff and volunteers for a regional grassroots summit. This is a chance to meet and network with the other grassroots leaders in your state, to learn or brush up on basic organizing skills, and to develop some local action plans that you can use to send Howard Dean to the White House. Thursday, November 20, 6:00pm
Please click on the link below to SIGN UP!

SEIU Rally
Little Hall Cafeteria
New England Technical College
31 College Drive
Concord, NH
During a three-day, four-state fly-around, the presidents of the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employee, AFL-CIO, International Union of Painters and Allied Trades, AFL-CIO, and the Service Employees International Union, AFL-CIO, will travel with Governor Dean to the key primary states of New Hampshire, Michigan, Iowa and New York.
At each stop, Governor Dean along with SEIU President Andy Stern, IUPAT President James Williams and AFSCME President Gerald McEntee, will be greeted by hundreds of local leaders, grassroots and labor supporters, excited to begin working to help Dean become the next president. For more information, please contact DFA Press Office, 802-651-3200.

event.location: CA, CO, NV, TX, AZ, NM
event.details:
Please join Dean volunteers from the Southwest over the weekend of Dec 6th and 7th, arriving Friday night, for this weekend initiative in AZ and NM.
Dean volunteers will be helping to register voters, and precinct walking to talk with frequent voters. The project is a coordinated effort with the Arizona and New Mexico campaigns, just before the final registration deadlines in those states. They're providing places to stay, potluck food, and vans for volunteers to get around. All you have to do is get there, or sign up to caravan with people who are already driving.
Working to secure all nominees from these critical battleground states, may be the most important thing you'll do until your own primary. If we can start a wave with NH, IA, AZ, and NM, we may be unstoppable.
If you have any questions, PLEASE CLICK ON THE Forum for America LINK BELOW and post them in our forums.

The Florida Democratic Party 2003 State Convention will be held December 5-7 at Disney's Coronado Springs Resort and Convention Center in Lake Buena Vista, Florida.
If you need more info. on this event please either email bmauk@deanforamerica.com or PLEASE CLICK on the LINK BELOW.

1941 - Japanese planes attacked the United States Pacific fleet at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, destroying many aircraft and ships. Canada declared war on Japan within a few hours of the attact, even before the United States declaration of war.

Dean volunteers will be helping to register voters, and precinct walking to talk with frequent voters. The Boston Tea Party took place as nearly 350 chests of tea were dumped off Griffin's Wharf into Boston Harbor as Colonial patriots, disguised as Indians, protested taxation without representation and the monopoly granted the East India Company.
